instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not charging.
threads.message:
I Replaced the palmrest for an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (palmrest came with a battery). The battery isn’t charging with a massage saying that I should change the battery. In system info it does stating that it has 18 cycle. 
Was wonder if the 87w charger for the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> works with the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> laptop? I’m about to replace the battery but hate to do it if my issue is due to something new Apple are doing preventing high watt charges from working on the lower watt systems.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not charging.
threads.message: Charger should work... could be a shitty battery

threads.title: [SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not charging.
[SOLVED]<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> battery not charging.
threads.message: yep, the batt. was bad, Thanks guys
